data.title: The Press Republican
data.meta_description: Kathryn Vickers passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the The Press Republican on 2011-11-06.
data.text: LA JUNTA, Colo. - Kathryn Lee (Kathy, Stella, Kate) Collier Vickers of La Junta, Colo., 51, died peacefully surrounded by family and friends on Oct. 4, 2011, in Aurora. A memorial service and celebration of her life was held on Oct. 12 at First Presbyterian Church of La Junta.. She was born on May 3, 1960, in Rochester, N.Y., to the late Thomas and Ruth (Richardson) Collier. She graduated from Moriah Central School in 1978, attended SUNY Geneseo and graduated from SUNY Plattsburgh. Her first teaching position was at La Junta HS in 1991, moving there after visiting family friends and falling in love with Colorado. She taught English, French and journalism.. She was married on June 25, 1994, to David Vickers. Kathy had four children, stepdaughter Rachel, 28, daughter Emily, 16, son Geoffrey, 14, and son Jacob Matthew, who died in childbirth on Jan. 3, 1996. She also taught at Pueblo Community College and then taught at Cheyenne Mountain HS in Colorado Springs until 2007, when she became permanently disabled. She continued to be as active as possible, caring for her family, her beloved pets and developing many diverse friendships. Deeply religious, a skilled musician and singer, she imbued her children with a love for music; she also rescued or adopted many dogs and cats.. She is survived by her husband, David; and children, Rachel, Emily and Geoffrey; sister, Karen (Rory) Gillespie; parents-in-law, Burton and Rhea Vickers; step grandsons, Devon Williams and Dominick Sullivan; sisters-in-law, Adele Vickers, Leigh Ann Collins and Lynne Harbaugh; and 12 nieces and nephews.. She was predeceased by her parents, Thomas and Ruth Collier; son, Jacob Matthew; and step grandson, Donovan Williams.. Donations can be made to the charity of choice. Please consider donations to: University of Colorado Hospital Burn Trauma Center, Mail Stop F485, 12401 East 17th Ave., Aurora, CO 80045.
